translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on Pairs
The Section on the Pairs in Direct and Reverse Order
The Pairs in the Sense Sphere

original: Nakāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nanakāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na kāmāvacaram dhammam paṭicca na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  nana kāmāvacaram dhammam paṭicca nana kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome state as condition, an unwholesome state arises, a condition by way of root condition … three.🔽With a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome state as condition, a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome state arises, a condition by way of root condition … three.

original: Nakāmāvacarañca nanakāmāvacarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na kāmāvacaram ca na na kāmāvacaram ca dhammam paṭicca na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome and a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome state as condition, an unwholesome state arises, a condition by way of root condition … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… aññamaññe cha …pe… purejāte āsevane dve …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā pañca pe aññamaññe cha pe purejāte āsevane dve pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on root cause there are nine. In the section on object there are four. In the section on predominance there are five. … In the section on mutual there are six. … In the section on prior and subsequent there are two. … In the section on development there are two. … In the section on dissociation there are nine.
